value:
Ah—the chirping of the birds. Even in
the most foreign of lands, it would
seem there is familiarity to be found.

My home, Serenes Forest, was rich
and bright beyond compare. One
day, that beauty will be restored.

Herons only eat fruit and nuts, but
that just means more meat for you.
Please don't refrain on my account.

You want to hear me sing? Perhaps
another time. Apologies, but the
moment has to be right.

The chaos of battle saps my strength.
That my body is not meant for war
is...vexing to say the least.

I am Reyson, of the heron clan. I've
been sent by $Nf
to wish you well.

The spirit of order invigorates me.
I can fight awhile longer.

Perhaps there is some strength in me
after all.
The spirit of chaos suffocates me...

I do feel a little more robust, now,
I must say.

I am Reyson, of Serenes Forest.
The heron clan does not easily trust,
I warn you. I will be watching closely.

I am grateful to you for saving my life,
$Nu. To fall to the
spirit of chaos was...shameful for me.$k$pIt is frustrating to feel as if I offer only
feelings in battle. I envy Tibarn's
powerful body and strong wings.$k$pIf I'd had his strength, I may have
been able to save myself from
capture, my home from the torch.$k$pThinking of my people's fate cleaves
my heart in two. I feel as if I failed
them, and I cannot forgive myself.$k$pWhat I can do is focus on my talents.
I know that I possess a rare gift,
and I do not mean to waste it.$k$pSo as thanks for saving me, and as
a sign of my trust and friendship...
I will sing for you.
はっ
くっ
うああっ！
くそっ…！
Stay back, you!
Repellent!
Unforgivable!
I will not be controlled!
Forgive me...
Sigh...
I wanted to make sure you were all right.
I'll accompany you.
We herons are optimistic by nature.
It's hard for me to be on a battlefield, where the air is thick with negative energy.
Do not worry. I can fight. I told you not to treat me specially.
I wanted so much to be like Tibarn. Big body, strong wings...
No matter what comes, I will protect you. I hope you'll let me fight beside you to the bitter end.
Yes?
What now?
Let us go.
